channel.title: ASF JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [HBASE-8421] hbase-0.95.0 tgz does not include lib/junit*.jar
item.description: The 0.95 release of hbase does not include junit-*.jar in the lib/ dir. This is required to run the hbase-it suite from the tarball.
item.summary: hbase-0.95.0 tgz does not include lib/junit*.jar

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.

comments.comment: Hmmm weird this has been fixed and broken a couple of times.
Who needs it?
integration tests and the perf test tools.
Looks like we need more than junit at runtime for it tests.
I'm looking at it...

I tried building trunk and 0.95 tarballs from the ref guide docs [1] but can't find tar. Are the docs out of date?


~/proj/hbase-0.95$ MAVEN_OPTS="-Xmx2g" mvn clean install javadoc:aggregate site assembly:assembly -DskipTests -Prelease -Dhadoop.profile=2.0



~/proj/hbase-0.95$ find -name "*.tar"

~/proj/hbase-0.95$ find -name "*gz"

./hbase-server/src/test/data/TestMetaMigrationConvertToPB.tgz

~/proj/hbase-0.95$ 



~/proj/hbase$ MAVEN_OPTS="-Xmx2g" mvn clean install javadoc:aggregate site assembly:assembly -Dhadoop.profile=2.0 -DskipTests -Prelease

~/proj/hbase$ find -name *gz

./hbase-server/src/test/data/TestMetaMigrationConvertToPB.tgz

~/proj/hbase$ find -name *tar

~/proj/hbase$

[1] http://hbase.apache.org/book.html#build

Looks like we need more than junit at runtime for it tests.

I only added a junit jar to the lib/ dir of an untarred 0.95.0 tarball and the was able to run them.


hbase org.apache.hadoop.hbase.IntegrationTestsDriver

Are the docs out of date?

The site is out of date. The doc in source have been updated. assembly:assembly -> assembly:single works well.

Unless i include mockito and hadoop-test I see class finder complaining ERROR missing. Some tests do proceed even though mockito and hadoop-test are missing. Presumed that this would be 'bad' (TM). Having trouble having hadoop-test show up at runtime....

This kinda thing:

The site is out of date. The doc in source have been updated. assembly:assembly -> assembly:single works well.

Did the trick. Thanks!
stack None of those tests are in hbase-it – they are generally part of hbase-server's tests (hbase-server-0.95.0-hadoop2-tests.jar)

I ran this from the manual:

bin/hbase [--config config_dir] org.apache.hadoop.hbase.IntegrationTestsDriver

Let me see if I can skip unit tests
Sorry, these error messages are useless and can can be ignored. I thought I filed a jira some time ago to remove/change them but forgot about it.
junit is indeed needed, I added it at some point in the past... it tests used to work from tarball a couple weeks or so ago.
I re-ran with assembly:single against 0.95 and trunk (hadoop2 builds) neither had junit included in the binary tarball.

Here is a patch which removes scoping of junit so it gets included in tgz. I tried it w/ no profile and seems to do the right thing. Patch also moves htrace to the end. Not necessary but harmless.

Over in HBASE-8428 I will deal w/ the ugly ERROR when I try running ITs against cluster.

+1, worked for me against trunk.


jon@swoop:~/proj/hbase$ MAVEN_OPTS="-Xmx2g" mvn clean install javadoc:aggregate site assembly:single -DskipTests -Prelease -Dhadoop.profile=2.0

...

jon@swoop:~/proj/hbase$ cd hbase-assembly/target

jon@swoop:~/proj/hbase/hbase-assembly/target$ tar tvfz hbase-0.97.0-SNAPSHOT-bin.tar.gz | grep junit

-rw-r--r-- jon/jon      245039 2013-02-01 07:06 hbase-0.97.0-SNAPSHOT/lib/junit-4.11.jar

jon@swoop:~/proj/hbase/hbase-assembly/target$

-1 overall. Here are the results of testing the latest attachment
http://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/attachment/12580445/8421.txt
against trunk revision .

+1 @author. The patch does not contain any @author tags.

-1 tests included. The patch doesn't appear to include any new or modified tests.
Please justify why no new tests are needed for this patch.
Also please list what manual steps were performed to verify this patch.

+1 hadoop1.0. The patch compiles against the hadoop 1.0 profile.

+1 hadoop2.0. The patch compiles against the hadoop 2.0 profile.

+1 javadoc. The javadoc tool did not generate any warning messages.

+1 javac. The applied patch does not increase the total number of javac compiler warnings.

+1 findbugs. The patch does not introduce any new Findbugs (version 1.3.9) warnings.

+1 release audit. The applied patch does not increase the total number of release audit warnings.

+1 lineLengths. The patch does not introduce lines longer than 100

+1 site. The mvn site goal succeeds with this patch.

-1 core tests. The patch failed these unit tests:
org.apache.hadoop.hbase.mapreduce.TestHFileOutputFormat
org.apache.hadoop.hbase.master.TestTableLockManager

Test results: https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-HBASE-Build/5436//testReport/
